details.notes:
• Demon Vessel Traits

    • Demon’s Vision

      • Thanks to your connection to pits of hell, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions.

        • You can see perfectly in darkness within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light.

      • Even when blinded, the Demon sees for you up to 30 feet.

    • Necrotic Resistance

      • The demon within has traveled among the dead many times within its limitless time on this plane.

        • You have resistance to necrotic damage.

    • Hell’s Resistance

      • You have resistance to Fire, Cold, and Lightning Damage

      • Immune to Charm, Fright, Confusion

      • Immune to Poison damage.

        • In fact, you heal for half the damage dealt.

    • Fiendish Vulnerability 

      • Corrosis makes you vulnerable to radiant damage.

  • Minotaur Monstrosity Traits

    • Child of the Mountain Raider Tribe

      • You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.

    • Labyrinthine Recall

      • The original Minotaur were caged in labyrinth’s and evolved the ability to perfectly recall any path they have traveled.

  • Charge

    • If you move at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hit with Horn Gore on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d4 piercing damage.

      • If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Contest or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

        • You have advantage on this roll, they have disadvantage.

damageImmunities: Poison (Heals for half the Damage Dealt)

system.description: Capacity: 30 pounds of gear or 1 cubic foot. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.
You gain advantage on Strength checks when you are able to apply leverage with this hooked metal bar.
This one-handed hammer with an iron head is useful for pounding pitons into a wall.
When a wall doesn’t offer handholds and footholds, you can make your own. A piton is a steel spike with an eye through which you can loop a rope.

A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. When you use a burning torch as a club to make a melee attack, it deals an extra 1 fire damage on a hit.

This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.
Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has an AC of 10, 2 hit points, and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

6lOxPh7I8y7B4XZx.label: Death's Presence - Moon Sickle Attack Roll

3LfFRfkWLTljnV8C.name: Death's Presence
3LfFRfkWLTljnV8C.label: Death's Presence - Moon Sickle Necrotic Damage Roll

y5DJhJ85AL9n1e8e.name: Moon Sickle
y5DJhJ85AL9n1e8e.label: Death's Presence - Moon Sickle Slashing Damage

system.description: Dual-Wielding, Simple, 1 d4 Necrotic damage and 1 d4 Slashing Damage

You’re well-versed in a variety of languages and codes, gaining the following benefits:

  • + 1 Intelligence Modifier on checks having to do with Cipher's or Languages

  • You can invent ciphers and are able to teach a cipher you create to others.

    • Anyone who knows the cipher can encode and read hidden messages made with it.

      • The apparent text must be at least four times longer than the hidden message.

      • Other creatures can detect the presence of the cipher if they spend a minute examining it and succeed on an Investigation check against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier.

        • If the check succeeds by 5 or more, they can read the hidden message.

Your expertise aids you in identifying Tomes/Artifacts of all races, living and dead, giving you insight into who created them and their original intent.

  • Add +1 to your Investigation Proficiency when doing so.

• When intimidating an enemy/hostile creature, your eyes ignite with the flames of hell to further get the point across.

    • +1 to any Intimidation Proficiency check against an enemy/hostile.

YISbvSfGwGFRBbsj.label: Eldritch Blast - Agonizing Blast Attack Roll

ifj1ZDeVImKbG99z.label: Eldritch Blast - Agonizing Blast Ability Check

system.description:
• A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

    • On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

      • Due to the demonic force within you, you also add your Charisma modifier to the attack.

  • Note: The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level.

    • You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones.

      • Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

 

Cast at Higher Level: The targets increase by one when you reach 5th level, 11th level, and 17th level.

• You gain one of the following benefits:

    • You may immediately make a single attack with your Demonic Gift.

      • This can only trigger once per turn.

    • You gain temporary hit points equal to your Warlock modifier + Your Warlock level

items.name: Child of the Mountain Raider Tribe

system.description: • You have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
• At the start of his turn, Mogli can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls he makes during that turn, but attack rolls against him have advantage until the start of his next turn.

1KPFUXnF33CEBOhC.onSave: You lose focus on your current mission

system.description:
• After the way your people were used and then violently betrayed by the Necromancers, you have a hard time not attacking Necromancers on sight.

    • Roll Wisdom Save of 15+ with Disadvantage

      • On a success, you lose focus on your current mission, but continue forward.

        • Disadvantage on any rolls that require your direct focus on a spell or action for 30 minutes.

      • On a fail, you Charge toward the Necromancer to Gore them and you have no limit to the distance traveled.

• At level one, some artifacts call to you, even if they’re buried deep in the earth.

    • Close your eyes and focus on their pull and they will reveal information to better aid you in recovering them.

      • Roll Wisdom + Tome Expertise Proficiency to hone in on exactly where they might be and the DM will give brief flashes of insight to help you discover the best way to get to the artifact.

yM33FYoGk51ExpZ7.description:
• Natural Weapons

    • Hit: 2d4 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage.

    • Reach: 5 ft.

Target: One Target

• Natural Weapons

  • If you move at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hit with Horn Gore on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d4 piercing damage.

    • If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Contest or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

      • You have advantage on this roll, they have disadvantage.

    • Hit: 4d4 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage.

    • Reach: 5 ft.

Target: One Target

system.description:
• Natural Weapons

    • Hit: 2d4 + Strength Modifier in Piercing Damage.

    • Reach: 5 ft.

Target: One Target

 

Charge

  • If you move at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hit with Horn Gore on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d4 piercing damage.

      • If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength Contest or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.

        • You have advantage on this roll, they have disadvantage.
• The original Minotaur were caged in labyrinth’s and evolved the ability to perfectly recall any path they have traveled.

DofuIEzfKA06zUdg.label: Ride the Bull Saving Throw
DofuIEzfKA06zUdg.onSave: Dislodged, but don't fall prone and take half damage

system.description:
• If a creature is on you or behind you, you may drop to your hands and kick your feet back to get them off of you/kick them away from you for 2d4 + Strength Modifier in Force Damage and are pushed 5 feet away from you.

    • They must roll a Dexterity save against your Manuever DC to take half damage and land on their feet

      • If they fail they also fall prone.

• Starting at level one, a fiery whip snaps from your body to touch a creature that has 0 hit points at a distance of no more than 15 feet.

    • The creature becomes stable.

    • This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

    • This can only be used once per short or long rest.

VJU9kUoVGcn0X1ya.label: From the Ribs of Adam Use Consumption

LSOoZbOBjS2NNiet.label: 2: You pulled out 1 rib, Creature loses 1 AC

KWwOZDeNZ86lND1m.label: 3-4: You pulled out 2 ribs, Creature loses 2 AC

WwOcLvJd17LklL9u.label: 5-6: You pulled out 3 ribs, Creature loses 3 AC

innDWanQSL0WQ19a.label: Undead Creature: You pulled out 3 ribs, Creature loses 3 AC

system.description:
• Starting at 2nd level, you can reach out and tug at the ribs of a creature, pulling several of them out, causing 1d6 damage piercing damage per rib if they're within 30 feet of you.

    • Roll 1d6

      • 1 you fail

      • 2 you pull 1 rib out

        • Creature loses 1 AC

      • 3-4 you pull out 2

        • Creature loses 2 AC

      • 4-6 you pull out 3

        • Creature loses 3 AC

        • Enemies within 5 feet of the target have to roll to save or be fearful of you for a turn.

    • These bones circle around your hand and grant you the following ability.

      • Rib Attack

        • These bones can be launched up to 30 feet as a free action, at any time, to do 1d6 piercing damage.

    • If the undead are being targeted, due to their decayed status, you instantly pull out 3 bones, but they don’t take damage from the attack.

      • They do, however, lose 3 AC

    • You may use this action an equal amount of times as your proficiency bonus per short or long rest.

• Starting at 2nd level, when you roll a natural 20 your demon within bolsters you with a boost to your lifeforce.

    • You gain 1d4 + 4 temporary hit points for one hour.

4hKjGIDKLWDkCJFC.name: Gathered Swarm Provoked Damage
4hKjGIDKLWDkCJFC.description:
• While alive and awake, this Swarm hides within your armor until provoked or stirred, at which point they burst out like a cloud.

    • This does 1d6 piercing damage to all enemies within 5 feet of you who fail a dexterity save.

YDxrbf8idPrrv50o.name: Gathered Swarm Assist Damage
YDxrbf8idPrrv50o.description: • The attack's target takes 1d6 piercing damage from the Swarm.

7QPWk4dwR8azGs7H.name: Gathered Swarm Assist Push
7QPWk4dwR8azGs7H.description: • The attack's target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved by the Swarm up to 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

8nZ7tr6rLd2upY2e.name: Gathered Swarm Assist Movement
8nZ7tr6rLd2upY2e.description: • You are moved by the Swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice without incurring attacks of opportunity.

system.description:
• At 3rd level, the bugs who feed on death feel you are a good creature to follow around and Swarm around you to assist in battle.

    • While alive and awake, this Swarm hides within your armor until provoked or stirred, at which point they burst out like a cloud.

      • This does 1d6 piercing damage to all enemies within 5 feet of you who fails a dexterity save.

    • If you die or fall unconscious, the Swarm remains in your space, crawling on you or flying and skittering around you within your space, biting all who approach for 1d6 piercing damage for all who fail a dexterity save.

      • Allies have advantage on the save.

    • Once on each of your turns, you can cause the Swarm to assist you in one of the following ways, immediately after you hit a creature with a melee attack:

      • The attack's target takes 1d6 piercing damage from the Swarm.

      • The attack's target must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be moved by the Swarm up to 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice.

      • You are moved by the Swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice without incurring attacks of opportunity.

    • If enough bugs within the Swarm would likely have died during battles between your allies and their enemies, the DM will likely give you disadvantage on Swarm abilities until you take a short rest, long rest, or enough time has passed for a new Swarm to believably have formed.

      • For example, in a clean building, that time would be considerably longer than in a recent battlefield strewn with rotting corpses.

• Beginning at 3rd level, you psychically link with the bugs that touch you allowing them to share their senses with you even at great distances for an hour.

      • The hour starts over the moment they touch you again.

4hKjGIDKLWDkCJFC.name: Swarm Hand 4 Creature Attack
4hKjGIDKLWDkCJFC.description: • Strike out up to 4 creatures within 10 feet causing 1d4 piercing damage.

system.description:
• Beginning at 3rd level, as an action, the fist can be formed from the Swarm at a point of your choosing within a 30 foot range.

    • You can use your action to control the hand to do the following:

      • Strike out up to 4 creatures within 10 feet causing 1d4 piercing damage.

        • Dex save against your Spell DC for half damage.

      • The Swarm wraps around an individual to cause 1d6 piercing damage, disrupting their concentration until your next turn.

        • Con save against your Spell DC to take half damage and retain focus.

• Demon’s Host

      • At 2nd level, as a true indicator of your pact, your patron has granted you a powerful innate ability known as your Demonic Gift, Demonic Invocations, Demonic Mutations, and Combat Traits.

      • Mogli Demonic Gifts, Invocations, Mutations, Combat Traits.docx

        • Demonic Gift

          • Your Demonic Gift is magical in nature, however it works even while in the presence of a zone of antimagic, and nothing can negate the usage of it.

          • When you attack, your Demonic Gift goes off once per turn as a free action.

          • Upon gaining a level in this class, you may exchange your Demonic Gift for a different one from the list of options.

        • Demonic Invocation

          • You delve into the deepest depths of Demonic Lore and have unearthed something powerful.

            • As you reach certain Warlock levels, you learn additional invocations, as shown in the Demonic Invocations column in the Warlock Class Table.

            • If a Demonic Invocation has prerequisites, you must meet them to learn it.

              • You can learn the invocation at the same time that you meet its prerequisites.

              • A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

            • Whenever you gain a level in this class, you may choose one of the Invocations you know and replace it with another invocation if you meet the prerequisites for.

        • Demonic Mutations

          • Corrosis has begun to better meld with your body.

            • As you reach certain Warlock levels, you meld additional mutations, as shown in the Demonic Mutations column in the Warlock Class Table.

            • If a Demonic Mutation has prerequisites, you must meet them to meld with them.

              • You can meld with the Mutation at the same time that you meet its prerequisites.

                • A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class.

              • Whenever you gain a level in this class, you may convince Corrosis to unmeld a Mutation to replace it with another if you meet its prerequisites.

        • Combat Trait

          • As you reach certain Warlock levels, you learn additional Combat Traits, as shown in the Warlock Class Table.

• At 3rd level, you can whisper an ancient word into a spell cast by an ally or enemy that you can see as they cast it.

    • You must burn a spell slot of equal value or greater to manipulate their magic in this way.

      • Discuss with the DM briefly if something is allowed, but have fun with this.

    • Examples of this:

      • You may whisper the ancient words for an element to add that type of damage to their attack.

      • Add healing to a spell that was originally only meant to push or pull or damage.

      • Add cleansing abilities to heal someone of poison when they’re healed of something else as well.

      • Have a spell backfire or find a new target.

• Your pact with Corrosis bestows upon you the ability to do Warlock Spells and Cantrips.

    • The number of Known Spells you may have is detailed in your Warlock Class Table.

      • They can be found here: http://dnd5e.wikidot.com/spells:warlock

    • Whatever spells you choose must be equal or lower to your highest spell slot, no greater than 5th.

      • Your Known Spells are always cast at the highest spell slot level you have available up to 5th.

        • Note: For example, Demonic Tome Magic does not up your spell slots available for Pact Magic.

      • These spells refresh after a short rest.

• Upon reaching 3rd level, you’ve spent a lot of time melding with Corrosis, these spells are now part of your Known Spells without taking up your Known Spell slots.

    • 1st Level

      • Burning Hands

      • Hellish Rebuke

    • 3rd Level

      • Flaming Sphere

      • Pyrotechnics

    • 5th Level

      • Ashardalon's Stride

      • Fireball

• A creature can use its action to eat one berry.
    • Eating a berry restores 1 hit point, and the berry provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
    • The berries lose their potency if they have not been consumed within 24 hours of the casting of this spell.
• At 2nd level, when Myra hits you with a Summoned Energizing Arrow, it recharge 1 of Mogli's Spell Slots.

As you hold your hands with thumbs touching and fingers spread, a
thin sheet of flames shoots forth from your outstretched fingertips.

Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving
throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as
much damage on a successful one.


The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren’t being
worn or carried.


At higher level: The damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

You point your finger, and the creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes 2d10 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

 

At higher level: The damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

• You reach out with a spectral hand that carries the chill of death.
    • Make a ranged spell attack.
      • On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage, and it cannot regain hit points until the start of your next turn.
        • The hand remains visibly clutching onto the target for the duration.
          • If the target you hit is undead, it makes attack rolls against you with disadvantage until the end of your next turn.

Cast at Higher Level: The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

 

Source: Players Handbook

FuHqAiNX9IxDpG82.label: Gravity Spike Save
FuHqAiNX9IxDpG82.onSave: Half damage and not knocked prone.

system.description:
• You create a localized gravitational field that temporarily shifts the landscape to impale a creature. 
    • Choose a creature on the ground you can see within range.
      • The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw.
        • On a failed save, the target takes 1d4 piercing damage and is knocked prone.
        • On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone.
        •  

Cast at Higher Levels: This spell’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th
level (2d4), 11th level (3d4), and 17th level (4d4).

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spell Book

BxSlFgN5rYN2SaHq.label: Reduced Damage and Damage Incurred upon attacker if 10 feet away.

system.description:
• You generate a barrier of elongated femurs that protects you.
    • You reduce the incoming damage by 1d12.
    • If the attacking enemy is within 10 feet of you, the osseous barrier explodes, dealing slashing damage to them equal to the amount reduced.

 

Cast at Higher Levels: The damage reduction increases by 1d12 for each slot level above 1st.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spell Book

• You conjure a cocoon made of cartilage and bones, which protects the creature that dropped to 0 hit points.
    • While in the cocoon, the creature can’t be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, has total cover, is considered restrained, and makes
      death saving throws at advantage.
    • The cocoon has 25 hit points and an AC of 11 + your
      spellcasting ability modifier.
      • It has resistance to cold, fire, and necrotic damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.
      • If you lose concentration or the cocoon is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.
system.materials: A shrunk and gilded rib cage worth at least 50 gp

system.description:
• You summon a large number of tentacles and slugs from your palm to strike a creature within range.
    • Make a melee spell attack against the target.
      • On a hit, it takes 3d6 bludgeoning damage.
        • If you score a critical hit, the target is also stunned until the start of your next turn.

 

Cast at Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6 and range increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spell Book
system.materials: Body part of a Great One

zHmFB6tOyAlBCpQn.label: Gravity Storm Save
zHmFB6tOyAlBCpQn.onSave: Half Damage and not Knocked Prone

bjkPYWZ6hgIct5QV.name: Gravity Storm Ongoing

zHmFB6tOyAlBCpQn.label: Gravity Storm Save
zHmFB6tOyAlBCpQn.onSave: Half Damage and not Knocked Prone

bjkPYWZ6hgIct5QV.description:
• At the start of each of your turns for the duration, each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw.
    • On a failure, a target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.
    • On a success, a target takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone.

system.description:
• You create a localized gravitational field that unleashes a storm of gravity waves.
    • Choose a point within range that you can see.
      • When you cast this spell, and at the start of each of your subsequent turns for the duration, each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw.
        • On a failure, a target takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.
        • On a success, a target takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked prone.

 

Cast at Higher Levels: The damage increases by 1d6, the radius increases by 5 feet, and the duration increases by 1 round, for each slot level above 2nd.

 

Source: Steinhardt's Guild Spell Book
system.materials: Body part of a Great One

system.description:
• These bones circle around your hand.

    • These bones can be launched as a free action, at any time, to do 1d6 piercing damage.

IU4xE6sxhaLZ1V5L.name: Fire Whip
IU4xE6sxhaLZ1V5L.description:
• Fire Whip

      • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

        • On a hit, the target takes 1d6 + your Warlock modifier in fire damage.

rb1zS7BHjsRpnmkC.name: Grasping Whip

x6rep1eYVZIhIGVW.label: Move or Pull you and the target 15 feet closer to one another

KjWdl3vy6796KUxs.label: Creature is considered Grappled until your next turn

rb1zS7BHjsRpnmkC.description:
• Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

    • On a hit, jerk yourself or the target 15-feet closer to one another.

      • The creature is considered grappled until your next turn

      • This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

    • You may target a surface with this ability for the purposes of moving yourself, if you do so it automatically hits.

system.description:
• As an action, you can send out a burning tendril towards a target within 60-feet of you.

    • You may take one of two options:

      • Fire Whip

        • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

          • On a hit, the target takes ld6 + your Warlock modifier in fire damage.

      • Grasping Whip

        • Make a ranged spell attack against the target.

          • On a hit, jerk yourself or the target 15-feet closer to one another.

            • The creature is considered grappled until your next turn

            • This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

          • You may target a surface with this ability for the purposes of moving yourself, if you do so it automatically hits.

D1vnkebVNppU0EXS.name: Shared Melding
D1vnkebVNppU0EXS.description:
• You touch a willing creature and bless them, granting them the benefits of one Demonic Mutation you currently have melded to yourself.

    • A single creature can only have one blessing from you.

    • You may only bless a number of creatures at a time equal to your Warlock modifier (Minimum of 1)

    • This lasts until you die, cut it off with a thought, or that creature takes a short/long rest.

system.description:
• As an action you may touch a willing creature and bless them, granting them the benefits of one Demonic Mutation you currently have melded to yourself.

    • This lasts until you die, cut it off with a thought, or that creature takes a short/long rest.

      • A single creature can only have one blessing from you.

      • You may only bless a number of creatures at a time equal to your Warlock modifier (Minimum of 1)

pYfWJUdrBRtvz0J4.label: Move creature effected by Whip of Corrossis 15 feet further in any direction.

system.description:
• When you use the Demonic Gift - Whip of Corrosis, you may use the whip to move the creature or object within 15-feet of their current position.

    • They cannot pass through walls, the ground, or obstructions.

      • You would need to count the spaces to circumnavigate obstructions or walls, just as you would normal movement.

      • You can, however, throw them into the air or push them into an obstruction or wall.

        • Grappled is still in effect, so their saving throw upon hitting the ground, wall, or obstruction will be rolled with disadvantage and the damage they take would be force damage with a die roll the DM deems necessary + your Warlock modifier.

    • A creature can only be affected by this feature once per round

• You can see normally in darkness and dim light, both magical and nonmagicaL to a distance of 120 feet.

    • You may select this mutation multiple times, each subsequent taking increases the range of this sight by 120- feet.

• As an action you may reach out with a telepathic tendril to create a connection between a creature so that you may hear what they are thinking and saying as though they were speaking or thinking in your primary language.

    • Beware: They can do the same with you.

    • If they are willing, this will happen without a save roll.

    • If unwilling, they must roll a Wisdom saving throw

    • You retain this connection until you use this action on a new creature or you take a short/long rest
• Short Rest = Long Rest for you

• When an attack misses you, you may move up to half of your speed as a reaction.

    • This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

VypibDJg4E0X9WeX.label: Swarm Hand Grab Damage Attack Roll

system.description:
• Beginning at 3rd level, as an action, the fist can be formed from the Swarm at a point of your choosing within a 30 foot range.

    • The hand lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed as an action.

    • The Swarm disperses and returns to you if ever more than 30 feet away from you or you form a new hand elsewhere.

    • You can use your action to control the hand to do the following:

      • Manipulate an object

      • Open an unlocked door or container

      • Stow or retrieve an item from an open container

      • Pour the contents out of a vial.

      • You can move the hand up to 30 feet each time you use it.

      • The hand can’t activate magical items or carry more than 10 pounds.

• This necklace was carved by Mogli for his youngest son before a Necromancer took the child's life.
    • He wears it to remind himself that his actions caused the deaths of children.
      • As long as he's wearing this, if he has to roll to avoid attacking a Necromancer, he can touch it to gain 1d4 toward the save.

JAlMZ4hY39SQtM8T.name: The Power of Suggestion
JAlMZ4hY39SQtM8T.description:
• Though he does have the authority to command the Derelicts, he chooses to make suggestions instead.
    • If they choose to do as suggested they gain Inspiration on the action.
  • Even if it's not his turn, as long as he can see an ally he can call out to them a suggestion by using his reaction.
  • Inside of combat he may use his reaction to utilize this Maneuver when he sees need for it.

system.description:
• Mogli has proven to be one who leads by example and has ample experience in all manner of things, granting him the following:
    • Outside of combat he always goes first. 
    • The Power of Suggestion 
      • Though he does have the authority to command the Derelicts, he chooses to make suggestions instead.
        • If they choose to do as suggested they gain Inspiration on the action.
      • Even if it's not his turn, as long as he can viably communicate with an ally, he can call out to them a suggestion by using his reaction.
      • Inside of combat he may use his reaction to utilize this Maneuver when he sees need for it.

• Taking the Dash action gives you additional movement, equal to your speed, for the current turn.
    • For a creature with a walking speed of 30ft, this means their movement for that turn would increase to 60ft.
      • This bonus includes any modifiers to your speed
      • This also applies to negative modifiers
      • Note: A situation that often causes confusion is when you Dash after standing up from being prone, which costs half of your movement.
        • Creatures with 30ft speed who are standing up from being knocked prone only has 15ft of movement remaining, but Dash doubles the original 30ft, and therefore they can move 45ft after getting up from being knocked prone.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You may use your Disarm maneuver to attempt to knock an item or weapon from a creature's hand.
    • The target must be within your reach and be holding an item (either carried or wielded).
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • The target has advantage if it is larger than you or holding the item with two or more hands
        • Alternatively, a target smaller than you has disadvantage.
          • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target drops the item in its space.

• Allows a character to evade opportunity attacks for the rest of their turn.
    • It’s a defensive tactic used when you want to safely move away from an enemy without risking a free swing.

• When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks.
    • Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker.
    • Addtionally, you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage.
    • Note: You lose these benefits if you are incapacitated or if your speed drops to 0.

• While you cannot grapple a creature two or more size categories larger than you, you can grab onto it.
    • By jumping onto its back or climbing up a limb, you can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against the creature's maneuver DC to cling to or balance upon its body.
      • On a success, you move into the creature's space and can move upon its body as if it is difficult terrain.
  • While grabbing onto a larger creature, you gain advantage on attack rolls against it.
    • The larger creature may be able to attack you as normal, depending on its limbs or attacks.
      • It can also use an action or replace one of its attacks on its turn to try to dislodge you, such as shaking you loose or bashing you against a wall, forcing you to make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against its maneuver DC or fall prone into the nearest space adjacent to the creature, taking its basic melee damage in the process.
  • If the creature chooses to roll over in order to dislodge you, it becomes prone, but you have disadvantage on the saving throw to hang on.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Grapple maneuver to grab or wrestle a creature
    • You must have at least one free hand to attempt a grapple, your target must be within your reach, and the target must be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and the target becomes grappled.
          • In addition to things that end the condition, you can release the target at any time (no action required).
  • Escaping a Grapple
    • While grappled, a creature can use its action to attempt to escape. It must succeed on a Strength or Dexterity saving throw against your maneuver DC.
  • Moving a Grappled Creature
    • When you move, you can drag or carry the grappled creature with you.
      • When you do so, your Speed is halved, unless the creature's weight is within your carrying capacity and you are not encumbered by bulky items.
  • Freeing a Grappled Creature
    • You can use the Grapple maneuver to try to free another grappled or restrained creature.
      • The creature grappling or restraining the target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • If it fails the saving throw, the grappled or restrained creature is freed.
        • Additionally, you may move the freed creature 5 feet in any direction.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Knockdown maneuver to trip or push a creature down.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
    • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
      • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and knock the target prone.

• You can use an action or bonus action to make an Overrun maneuver to move through a hostile creature's space by forcing your way past.
    • Make a Strength saving throw against the target's maneuver DC.
      • On a success, you deal basic melee damage and can move through the hostile creature's space once this turn.
      • The creature can choose to let you pass instead of rolling.
      • You have advantage if you are larger than the target, or disadvantage if you are smaller.
      • If you are two or more sizes smaller than the target, you can move through the hostile creature's space without making a save.
      • You still provoke opportunity attacks if you move beyond a creature's reach.

• If you are able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this maneuver replaces one of them.
  • You can use the Shove maneuver to push a creature away.
    • The target must be within your reach and be no more than one size category larger than you.
      • The target makes a Strength saving throw against your maneuver DC.
        • On a failure, you deal basic melee damage and push the target a number of feet away from you equal to 5 + 5 for every 5 points it failed its saving throw by.
          • You can move the creature in any direction away from you (to the side, forward, or diagonally away).
    • A creature that is shoved off of a precipice is propelled off of whatever it is standing on -- it does not receive any saving throw or ability check to grab onto something to avoid falling down below.

• Instead of using a weapon to make a melee weapon attack, you can use an unarmed strike: a punch, kick, head-butt, or similar forceful blow (none of which count as weapons).
    • On a hit, an Unarmed Strike deals bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + your Strength modifier.
      • You are proficient with your unarmed strikes.
      • This damage cannot be halved by a saving throw.

rT3HMG7npzkMwwXV.name: Hákarl’s Trident Thrown - Strengthened Weapon
rT3HMG7npzkMwwXV.description:
• Damage: 1d8

  • Damage Type: Piercing

  •  Range: 10-80 feet

system.description:
• Hákarl’s Trident - Divine Implement - Ranged Weapon

    • Damage: 1d8 + 2 (Strengthened Weapon)

    • Damage Type: Piercing

    • Item Rarity: Magical Artifact

    • Properties: Range, Thrown, Two Handed

    • Thrown Range: 10/80 feet

    • Weight: 4

    • This was the one and only thing Hákarl was found with.

      • Its uses besides fighting are unknown.

One of the many secrets unveiled about Sevani Dreigh Ude by Mogli is the discovery of how to create Portal Coins for his Elite Warriors. By sacrificing his own life force, one full year to be exact, he can fuse a coin to the blood of one of his Elite. Only the person fused to the coin can use the Portal Coin to return to Sevani Dreigh Ude. These coins can also be used by his Elite to return to Mogli's side, but this can only occur once per day as he does not carry the same amount of power to move creatures across the cosmos as Sevani Dreigh Ude encompasses.

 

Mogli may use his coin to teleport he, and all within 10 feet of him, to another Derelict Warrior's side. This can only occur once per day and must be recharged by him spilling his own blood upon it before dawn the next day.
Heavy, Parrying, Two-Handed

Niiztj8RZDcPs2XZ.label: True Death's Kiss Addtional Undead Damage

vSci6HivqSMMYqjp.label: Turn Undead - Undead Wisdom Saving Throw

system.description:
• This finely crafted blade hums with a strange energy.
    • It deals an additional 1d6 radiant damage to undead creatures.
    • Once per day, when unsheathing this blade, you may cast “Turn Undead”
      • Effect: When facing undead creatures, this equates a cleric revealing their  holy symbol to Undead Creatures.
        • Each undead that can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw of 15.
          • If they fail, they are “turned” for 1 minute or until they take damage.
            • This causes them to use their reaction or action to run away from you to their full movement (even if they have already moved this round)

iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.name: Mold Earth
iTCXV3iJO1HG6QnT.description:
• You choose a portion of dirt or stone that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

    • If you target an area of loose earth, you can instantaneously excavate it, move it along the ground, and deposit it up to 5 feet away. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage.

    • You cause shapes, colors, or both to appear on the dirt or stone, spelling out words, creating images, or shaping patterns. The changes last for 1 hour.

    • If the dirt or stone you target is on the ground, you cause it to become difficult terrain. Alternatively, you can cause the ground to become normal terrain if it is already difficult terrain. This change lasts for 1 hour.

system.description:
• When activated, for the next 10 minutes, you can cast Mold Earth at will.
  • This rune has 1 charge per day and regains its charge at dawn

• At Level 3, Mogli has built up a rather large crew of Derelict agents and may use a bonus action to reach out telepathically using his Portal Coin once during an event to those within 5 miles of him.

    • Roll 1d6

      • 1: Nobody answers the call.

      • 2: One agent arrives within a few rounds out of breath from running to aid you, causing them to have disadvantage on their first action.

      • 3-4: One agent arrives during the next round.

      • 5: An agent was quite literally just down the road and walks in ready to help with whatever is needed.

      • 6: Multiple agents arrive, one this round and more when the DM decides it makes sense for them to.

        • Possibility of an entire group arriving (if it makes sense for them all to be in the area).

    • Alternatively, when in a city, he can use this ability to call out to those within the city to announce his arrival.

      • This pinpoints their locations, opening up additional options for the players. (Examples include, but are not limited to, shops opening, knowledgeable NPCs, new quests, rumors, information about current goals.)
